clinical_study.brief_title: SedLine for Monitoring EEG Characteristics in Neurosurgical Patients-1
clinical_study.official_title: SedLine for Monitoring EEG Characteristics of Different Sedation Depths in Neurosurgical Patients-1

brief_summary.textblock: Electroencephalogram (EEG) is be used to assess the depth of anesthesia.The SedLine brain function monitoring has four simultaneous channels of frontal EEG waveforms and helps to monitor the state of the brain under anesthesia with bilateral data acquisition and process of EEG signals. The purpose of this study is to observe and compare the EEG signatures (such as SEF, PSI, DSA, etc.) at various levels of sedation in neurosurgical patients administered with different intravenous anesthetics.

primary_outcome.measure: Spectral edge frequency 95% (SEF95) changes at different sedation depths in neurosurgical patients
primary_outcome.time_frame: Prior to anesthesia induction, three minutes after reaching the target level of sedation
primary_outcome.description: SEF95 will be measured at awake, eye-closed state and after reaching the steady-state sedation depths of OAA/S=3 and OAA/S=1.

intervention.description: Prior to anesthesia induciton, EEG signatures will be recorded at Observer's Assessment of Alertness/Sedation (OAA/S) score of 5 (awake, eye-close state) for few minutes.

Given sedative anesthetics (propofol, midazolam or dexmetomidine), EEG signatures will be recorded after reaching steady state of OAA/S=3 (responds only after name called loudly and/or repeatedly) for few minutes.
Increasing drug concentration, EEG signatures will be recorded after reaching steady state of OAA/S=1 (does not respond to noxious stimuli) for few minutes.

study_pop.textblock: The population will be selected from patients who schedule to receive elective unilateral frontal intracranial tumor resection in Beijing Tiantan Hospital.
